description.short: Numania is a mobile mathematical guessing game for kids in elementary school. It was a part of the Computer Learning course assignment.
description.long: Numania is a mobile game for kids where the gameplay is guessing mathematical numbers based on certain conditions, for example, the large or small value of a number. This project involved a team of five with different roles, including the game designer, game programmer, game artist, and game sound designer. I served as a game artist in this project, in which I designed & drew various visual assets for the game UI. I entirely generated the assets using Figma with its vector tools. Some of the assets I created were the app logo, background art, buttons, menus, & game-level UI. As of today, the game is still in the prototype state.

images.caption: Assets for the Level Stage Screen, consisting of the gameplay board, number button, gameplay buttons, timer indicator, coins counter, & lives counter.

description.short: Subaku is a web app project that provides information about scholarships and how to apply for them. It served as the final project in the Ruangguru Bootcamp Program in 2022.
description.long:
Subaku was one of the earliest projects I had done. This project was deeply memorable because it was the first project where I had to collaborate with new people other than my college friends. I worked in a team of seven with two web stacks: front-end & back-end. The front-end development utilized React as the library, while the back-end used Go programming language.
This project was a part of front-end web projects in the Rungguru Bootcamp program. As the final one, this project aimed for every participant to implement everything taught for four months in the Bootcamp. The deadline to finish the project was only a month. Unfortunately, the project has not yet been completed due to time limitations. However, there were still some website components that had been developed & these components are available to view in the gallery below.

description.short: Inviora is a book & reference app that provides selected information on endangered plants worldwide. The app was a part of course projects in the Dicoding Android Developer Bootcamp.
description.long: Inviora development took place in the early stage of the Dicoding Android Developer Bootcamp after completing Kotlin fundamental course. The app development objective was to introduce participants to Android Studio. Moreover, it also taught participants to implement Activity, Intent & RecyclerView to an applicable Android project. The given theme of the app was uncategorized so that participants could choose any theme as long as it stuck with the main app's objectives. I chose the book & reference type of app with the theme of endangered plants because I'm into plants & flora so much. I took the plant information from the Wikipedia site. I named the app "Inviora," a combination between "invisible" & "flora." The app development only took two weeks, between July & August 2022. The app evaluation process was on August 5th, 2022, and resulted in a perfect score of 5/5 stars. Later on, the app is available to the public.

description.short: Mom & Kids App is a parental & toddler educational multi-platform mobile app. The intention of the project development was for the internship program at Sagara Technology in 2023.
description.long: Mom & Kids App is one of the projects handled by Sagara Technology. The initial development started before my internship program took place. The front-end development began when I joined the internship, causing me to develop the app's UI code from zero. This experience was quite challenging because I only have developed mobile apps for Android instead of multi-platform. Thanks to my mentor's guide & free courses available on the internet, I successfully delivered 7 out of 11 core front-end pages. Unfortunately, I couldn't continue my contribution to the app because my contract was over & I couldn't extend it due to the college priority. I'm eternally grateful for everything I've experienced in this company & project.

description.short: GitHubUser App is an Android app that lets you search, view, & bookmark GitHub users' profiles. The app was a part of the Dicoding Android Developer Bootcamp, which was the final project.
description.long: GitHubUser App development took place in the Dicoding Android Developer Bootcamp. The app development aims to teach the participant about implementing APIs (GitHub API for this context) into the Android App project. The app development consisted of two parts. The first part took place from September to October 2022 and aimed to implement the initial features: the user search & the user profile feature. The last part of development took place from October to November 2022. In this part, the app development focused on the favoriting user feature & the dark mode switch. On November 18th, 2022, the app evaluation happened. It passed all testing cases, resulting in a score of 4 out of 5. On the same day, the app was released to the public.

description.short: An e-commerce project that born from the curiosity of a group of students back in 2021. The beloved project has brought them several achievement, including a fully functioning web app that serves their customers in 2023.
description.long:
Dermanifest is a small Jakarta-based bodycare product that operates their business since 2021. Dermanifest began its initial development from a small college project. The project started with a limited range of products and marketing platform. Over time, the business project grew, expanding its product line and marketing channels. As in 2022, the project was submitted to the Student Entrepreneurship: PMW UNJ 2022 in Universitas Negeri Jakarta, Indonesia. In the aforementioned program, the project became a small operating business and achieved several achievements, namely receiving intensive entrepreneurial training along with passing entrepreneurial funding. With those opportunity, the business started to develop and launch its own web app e-commerce in 2023.
blelenlelelebelbel

shipping-cost: RajaOngkir — Indonesian shipping cost API service

It contains of a small table that resembles the Cart table & a summary section on the left side, and a checkout form that consists of recepient data, delivery address & options on the right side. The delivery information is provided by RajaOngkir API.

images.name: Order History
images.caption: Order History Section. It's a section below the profile detail that tabulates every created order. It has selectable tabs based on the order's status.
